title: How to Make Shchi

steps.headline: In a large heavy bottomed pot, combine all the stock ingredients and bring to a boil over medium high heat.
Once the stock is boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 3 to 4 hours.
steps.description: Skim and discard any meat scum that is floating on the surface of the stock.

steps.headline: Remove the beef brisket from the pot and set it aside in a bowl to cool.
steps.description:
Meanwhile, strain the stock through a fine sieve and throw out the bones and vegetables. Set the stock aside. After the brisket is cooled, chop it into bite sized pieces. steps.description:

steps.headline: Add in the potatoes, tomatoes, salt and pepper and simmer for an additional 20 minutes.
Serve hot among bowls with a slice of hearty rye bread and garnish with a dollop of sour cream.

text:
In a large heavy bottomed pot, combine all the stock ingredients and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Once the stock is boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 3 to 4 hours. Skim and discard any meat scum that is floating on the surface of the stock. Remove the beef brisket from the pot and set it aside in a bowl to cool. Meanwhile, strain the stock through a fine sieve and throw out the bones and vegetables. Set the stock aside. After the brisket is cooled, chop it into bite sized pieces. Set aside. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Make-Shchi-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Shchi-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Make-Shchi-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Shchi-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Clean the pot and place over medium-high heat. Heat the oil. Add the onions and sauté for 3-4 minutes or until wilted. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Add the cabbage and sauté for an additional 4-5 minutes until it's cooked down and wilted. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Shchi-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Pour in the stock slowly and add the chopped brisket. Bring to a boil. After boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Make-Shchi-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Shchi-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Make-Shchi-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Shchi-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Add in the potatoes, tomatoes, salt and pepper and simmer for an additional 20 minutes. Serve hot among bowls with a slice of hearty rye bread and garnish with a dollop of sour cream. Enjoy!
